Porous materials play a fundamental role in catalysis, water treatment, gas uptake, drugs adsorption, controlled delivered of substances and other applications that are very important in chemical, physical and biological processes. In the last two decades, the research about porous materials has increased substantially with emphasis in synthesis of Metal Organic Frameworks (MOFs) and Covalent Organic Frameworks (COFs). Therefore, this work aims to show methods in synthesis of nanoporous solids. The starting point was inspired in UiO -66 synthesis, already reported in literature. Then, an analogous synthesis with the build block norbixin that was extracted from achiotte seeds was accomplished. The materials characterizations were performed by mid infrared spectroscopy, nuclear resonance magnetic (NMR), X-ray diffraction, BET analysis, thermogravimetric analysis and t-plot method. Although the porous material has not become crystalline, its relatively surface area (400 m2g-1) apparently with some microporous and mesoporous cavities, thus being a promise to improvement and to be used in several applications.
